title: [Large-Scale] Discussion Simulation Course for Collaborative Argument-Based Language Learning (CABLE)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic argumentative structures, experience with digital collaboration tools, ability to utilize basic grammar and academic vocabulary
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative language learning via VR simulations in BYOD environments, focusing on integrated speaking/listening skills and argumentative text construction

learning_goals: Learners perform the role of Knowledge Integrator in structured argumentative discussions on controversial topics, demonstrating logical expression and critical reading skills.

Learners implement interaction patterns of a Discussion Facilitator (e.g., prompting questions, summarizing perspectives, refining vocabulary) with 80% accuracy in three or more argumentative discussions.
Learners analyze the correlation between individual argumentative contribution (Viewpoint Contributor) and group performance to design optimal text-based participation strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
